instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00138: What is 820-00138? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.U5000: What is U5000? This is the System Management Controller(SMC) in macbooks from 2013-2015.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.C7125: What is C7125? Capacitor between CHGR_BOOT and CHGR_PHASE important for bootstrapping creation of PPBUS_G3H on 2013-2015 macbook pros.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - not charging - magsafe green light blink [SOLVED]
threads.message:
Hey everybody

I've got an issue with <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> motherboard.

It doesn't charge the new battery, had to replace as previous, was inflated.

History : a customer brought the laptop cause wasn't powering on. When opened, the battery was inflated with a lot of dusty mess all around

So I replaced the battery and cleaned all around. After a week a so the happy customer came back saying it wasn't charging( or very slow during night when not used)

So now when plugin different (original) know working magsafe chargers it blinks green. When unplug the battery the magsafe stays steady amber.

The macbook works but unable to charge.

Here some measurements i did (based on similar issue from forum) : 

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> on F7700 - 16.21V - without battery connected
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> on F7700 -  fluctuates 10.81V to 16.1V - with battery connected
<SIGNAL>SMC_CHGR_BMON</SIGNAL> - on <RESISTOR>R5423</RESISTOR> - 0.66mV - without battery
<SIGNAL>SMC_CHGR_BMON</SIGNAL> - on <RESISTOR>R5423</RESISTOR> - jumping from 0.66mV to 253 mV - with battery
Resistance between pins 27/28 on <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> - 21.4 omhs
<CHIP>U7001</CHIP> - pin 5 - 3.42V
<CHIP>U7001</CHIP> - pin 1,2 - fluctuates from 0 up to 4V when battery and charger connected
<CHIP>U7100</CHIP> - pin 14  - fluctuates from 0 up to 4V when battery and charger connected
<CHIP>U5000</CHIP> - <RESISTOR>R5187</RESISTOR> - 2.8V

<CHIP>U7100</CHIP> was corroded (here some pics) replaced with donor board magsafe still blinking

All measurements were made with original <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> cleaned and resoldered

Thank  you for your help

Regards

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - not charging - magsafe green light blink [SOLVED]
threads.message:
btw forgot to mention, tested with two original magsafe
and two different batteries known good

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - not charging - magsafe green light blink [SOLVED]
threads.message:
"<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> on F7700 - 16.21V - without battery connected"
Are you sure???
If yes, change <TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR>.
Be sure <CAPACITOR>C7125</CAPACITOR> is good.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - not charging - magsafe green light blink [SOLVED]
threads.message:
oh sorry 20V with 85W charger and 16.21V with 60W charger
checked <TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR> getting 20V with 85W charger
<CAPACITOR>C7125</CAPACITOR> wasn't sure if good so replaced from donor 
Went from 1.3 mohms to 0.5 mohms

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - not charging - magsafe green light blink [SOLVED]
threads.message:
thanks for your reply

I removed the <TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR> and it was shorted indeed ))

I ordered a new part [URL]https://www.mouser.fr/ProductDetail/863-NVTFS4C06NWFTAG[/URL]

Which I received but its too small ))

Here some pics

Do you know where can I get this part ? cause the donor board doesn't have the same and I can't find the same specs 

Thank you 

Best regards

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - not charging - magsafe green light blink [SOLVED]
threads.message:
You can get it from normal laptop boards too (not Apple only).
The high-side MOSFET from any CPU/GPU power supply is more than you need; just pick the correct package.
